episodes.title: Behind the obscure, wealthy Plymouth Brethren who some call a 'cult' | ABC NEWS
episodes.description:
Four Corners investigates the Plymouth Brethren christian group, who Anthony Albanese has described as a 'cult'.
Journalist Louise Milligan speaks to a man who  alleges he was brutally abused by church members as a child.
The church's settlement offer was contingent on him agreeing to never speak to media or disparaging the group in any way.
Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE
Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-09-15/exclusive-brethren-plymouth-alleged-abuse-nda-four-corners/105762208

episodes.title: Elizabeth Struhs's parents sentenced to 14 years for manslaughter | ABC News
episodes.description:
The parents of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs, who died after her insulin was withheld, have been sentenced to 14 years in jail for her manslaughter.

episodes.title: Religious group leader believed God would save Elizabeth Struhs | ABC News
episodes.description:
The self-proclaimed leader of a religious group accused of causing the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs has told a court the case against them is "religious persecution" and that the defendants don't care what judgement is delivered.

Elizabeth, a type 1 diabetic, died in her Toowoomba home between January 6 and January 7, 2022, after her insulin was withheld.

Two members of the group – Elizabeth's father Jason Richard Struhs and the religious group's leader Brendan Luke Stevens – are charged with murder while 12 others, including Elizabeth's mother Kerrie Elizabeth Struhs and older brother Zachary Alan Struhs, are charged with manslaughter.

"We don't come to fight the charge because the charge is one that is completely contrary to God and we have no intention of fighting the law," 62-year-old Mr Stevens told the Supreme Court in Brisbane on Friday.

Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE
Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2024-07-12/elizabeth-struhs-murder-trial-religious-group-toowoomba-brisbane/104090834

episodes.title: Elizabeth Struhs's mother believed God would look after her, court hears | ABC News
episodes.description:
Members of a religious group charged over the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs spent a day and a half praying and singing over her dead body in the hope she would be raised from the dead by God, a Supreme Court trial has heard.

Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE
Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2024-07-11/elizabeth-struhs-murder-trial-religious-group-toowoomba/104085282

The court heard authorities were not called for 36 hours after the girl, who was a type 1 diabetic, died on a mattress on the floor of her Toowoomba home, west of Brisbane, in January 2022.

It is alleged the girl died after her insulin was withheld for days out of her family's belief God would heal her.

Her parents, Jason and Kerrie Struhs, along with Brendan Stevens — the alleged leader of the religious group — and his wife and children, are among 14 people who are facing the Supreme Court in Brisbane charged with murder and manslaughter.

episodes.title: How the Church of Scientology tried to bring down Paulette Cooper
episodes.description: Journalist Paulette Cooper was once the Church of Scientology's public enemy number one. After publishing a book critical of the church in the 1970's she was harassed in a vicious campaign which included death threats and being framed for a serious crime.
